roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Animals)
Mention an animal in response to 3 different questions.
Make an animal noise. (If this completes your Obsession, wait 30 seconds to murder the Investigator.)

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Thoroughness)
3 times, interrupt the Investigator to add detail to a description.
Continue to describe something until interrupted.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Conflict)
Describe 3 verbal disagreements you've had.
Insult the Investigator 2 times.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Long Term Memory)
You may not discuss anything that happened before you woke up this morning.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Evaluation)
You may not express opinions.
You may only state observable facts.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Familiarity)
You may not mention any people other than strangers or enemies.

primaries.requirement: Share a plan for some time in the next seven days.
prompts: What are you doing this weekend?
How will tomorrow be different from today?

primaries.requirement: Describe a project or task they worked on recently.
prompts: What did you do today?
What have you read or played recently that you would recommend?

primaries.requirement: Share a conversation they had recently or expect to have.
prompts: Who did you talk to first today?
Tell me about someone you work with.

secondaries.requirement: Guess what another person might have thought.
prompts: Tell me if the other person thought the conversation went badly or well.
How did the people you were with see it?

secondaries.requirement: Describe something they enjoyed or expect to enjoy.
prompts: What was a fun thing you did while you were there?
What hobbies or leisure activies do you plan to engage in this weekend?

secondaries.requirement: Describe a challenge they recently faced.
prompts: What was the hardest part of that conversation?
What did you struggle with today?

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Tradition)
Explain where you got the idea for 3 things you've made up.
Guess the inspiration for 2 of the Investigator's questions.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = World-Building)
Mention the same imagined thing in response to 4 questions.
Mention 3 imaginary locations.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Simplicity)
Give 1-word answers to 3 questions. Don't elaborate until asked.
Answer 2 questions nonverbally. Stay silent until prompted.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Visualization)
You may only mention objects that you can see from where you are sitting.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Stability)
Once the Investigator has mentioned a specific person, place, or thing (other than you), you may no longer mention that thing.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Flexibility)
Once you have mentioned an animal, vegetable or mineral, you may not mention examples of the other two types of things for the rest of the round.

primaries.requirement: Describe a new thing of a given type.
prompts: If you could have any magical power, what would it be?
What's a question I should have asked you, but haven't?

primaries.requirement: Describe something the Suspect has never seen.
prompts: What would it be like to walk on a distant planet?
Describe an impossible shape for me.
Once upon a time, a mouse, a bird, and a sausgae joined foces ...
I didn't want to kill him, but ...

secondaries.requirement: Explain the implications of something the Suspect came up with.
prompts: If the thing you described existed, what else would exist?.
What would it be like to interact with the thing you've invented?

secondaries.requirement: Imagine something again with an extra constraint.
prompts: Now tell the story from the perspective of the horse.
Now describe the place again, in only six words.

secondaries.requirement: Describe the opposite of something the Suspect has already described.
prompts: Now tell the same story, but with a tragic ending
And what magical power does your arch nemesis have?

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Justice)
Describe how 3 things seem unfair to you.
2 times, say what you think should have happened instead.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Blame)
3 times, blame someone else for something.
3 times, blame yourself for something.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Familiarity)
Describe dealing with 3 different tragedies the same way.
Refer to the same friend or family member 4 times.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Consideration)
You may not say the words "think", "thought", "feel", or "felt".

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Emotional Vocabulary)
You must describe emotions only using physical descriptions (like "crying" or "sweaty palms").
rather than names (like "sad" or "nervous").

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Acceptance)
You may only describe good consequences, and you must take credit for them.

primaries.requirement: Describe a time someone the suspect cared about was sad.
prompts: What was the last thing that made your father cry?
What was the most difficult decision your parents ever had to make?

primaries.requirement: Explain how the suspect felt when they gained something they didn't want.
prompts: How did you react when your parents explained death to you?
Tell me about a time you found out you were sick and how you reacted.

primaries.requirement: Explain how it felt to lose something/someone precious to the suspect.
prompts: What was the hardest goodbye you've ever had to say? How did you cope?
Tell me about a goal that you had to abandon.

secondaries.requirement: Explain how the suspect overcame an experience.
prompts: When did you know you were going to be okay?
Tell me about something that helped you get through that experience.

secondaries.requirement: Share something the suspect learned from the experience.
prompts: What did that feeling teach you to appreciate?
Why do you think that thing happened the way it did?

secondaries.requirement: Explain how an event affected someone else.
prompts: Who was hurt worse than you?
Whom do you wish had been hurt more?

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Precedent)
Tell an anectdote about someone else in response to 3 questions.
Mention how you solved 2 problems the last time they arose.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Persistence)
Describe attempting the same solution in 3 scenarios.
Attempt 3 very similar solutions to the same problem.

roles.name: Violent Robot
directives: (Obsession = Backstory)
Establish how you got into 3 hypothetical situations.
Reveal 2 things that qualify you to solve a given problem.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Complexity)
Any problem you solve, you must solve in two steps or less.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Simplicity)
You may not describe yourself accomplishing a goal with fewer than three steps.

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Activity)
You may not describe yourself taking any physical action. You may use the hypothetical "you".

roles.name: Patient Robot
directives: (Vulnerability = Improvisation)
You may not describe any solution that is unrelated to your Suspect Note.

primaries.requirement: Describe at least five different uses for an ordinary object.
prompts: How many uses for a paperclip can you come up with?
What do you think is the most versatile household object, and why?
You are in a kitchen, holding a small child. A dish towel catches fire. How do you put it out?
You are in a landslide. How do you survive?
You wake up in a room with four seamless walls, and infinitely thick ceiling and floor. How do you escape?
I'm going to tell the deparment you're a robot, and there's nothing you can do about it. What now?

secondaries.requirement: Describe a second, different solution to a problem.
prompts: How else would you solve it?
What if you couldn't get the resources that solution would require?

secondaries.requirement: Solve a problem again with an additional obstacle.
prompts: Could you improvise a solution using only a screwdriver?
What if you had to do it without hands?

secondaries.requirement: Explain their thought process in arriving at a solution.
prompts: How did you arrive at that solution?
What's a solution you thought of, but rejected, along the way?
